00023 #include "enetclient.h"
00024 
00025 #include "logger.h"
00026 
00030 RainbruRPG::Network::EnetClient::EnetClient(){
00031   init();
00032 
00033   connected=false;
00034 
00035   /* create a client host */
00036   /* only allow 1 outgoing connection */
00037   /* 56K modem with 56 Kbps downstream bandwidth */
00038   /* 56K modem with 14 Kbps upstream bandwidth */
00039   client = enet_host_create (NULL , 1 , 57600 / 8 , 14400 / 8 );
00040   address=new ENetAddress();
00041 
00042 }
00043 
00047 RainbruRPG::Network::EnetClient::~EnetClient(){
00048   enet_peer_disconnect(peer, 0);
00049   enet_host_destroy(client);
00050 
00051   delete address;
00052 
00053   client=NULL;
00054   address=NULL;
00055 
00056   deinit();
00057 }
00058 
00066 void RainbruRPG::Network::EnetClient::
00067 connect(const char* hostName, enet_uint16 port, int waitingTime){
00068 
00069   if (!connected){
00070     // Sets the server adress
00071     enet_address_set_host (address, hostName);
00072     address->port = port;
00073     
00074     /* Initiate the connection, allocating the two channels 0 and 1. */
00075     peer = enet_host_connect (client, address, 2);    
00076     
00077     if (peer == NULL){
00078       LOGE("No available peers for initiating an ENet connection.");
00079     }
00080     
00081     /* Wait up to 5 seconds for the connection attempt to succeed.*/
00082     if (enet_host_service (client, & event, waitingTime) > 0 &&
00083         event.type == ENET_EVENT_TYPE_CONNECT){
00084       LOGI("Connection to server succeeded.");
00085       connected=true;
00086       
00087     }
00088     else{   
00089       /* Either the 5 seconds are up or a disconnect event was */
00090       /* received. Reset the peer in the event the 5 seconds   */
00091       /* had run out without any significant event.            */
00092       enet_peer_reset(peer);
00093       LOGE ("Connection to server failed.");
00094     }
00095   }
00096   else{
00097     LOGW("Trying to connect an already connected client");
00098   }
00099 }
00100 
00108 bool RainbruRPG::Network::EnetClient::isConnected(){
00109   return connected;
00110 }
00111 
00117 void RainbruRPG::Network::EnetClient::sendPacket(NetPacketBase* p){
00118   p->netSerialize();
00119 
00120   ENetPacket * packet = enet_packet_create 
00121     (p->getData(), p->getDataLength(), 0);//, ENET_PACKET_FLAG_RELIABLE);
00122 
00123   enet_peer_send (peer, 0, packet);
00124   enet_host_flush (client);
00125 
00126 }
